result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within one year of release from custody.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Defendant advised he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Antyon Simmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court sentenced defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 4 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within one year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.

Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point worker ELISE JOSEPHSON.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  COURT SUGGESTS STATUS HEARING BEFORE DEFENDANT'S SCHEDULED PLEA HEARING.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with Michael Beckman, student intern under supervision of attorney Alexis Liggins.  Dennis Murphy for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case was originally calendared for January 28, 2014. Courthouse complex was closed, case heard today.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Marcus Antyon Simmons in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
